alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:28PM EDT until July 29 at 11:28PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Flooding begins in some basements. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EDT Thursday was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 03/04/1997. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 9 PM EDT.
